versions.name: South Australia
chorus: Haul away your rolling king, heave away, haul away
Haul away, you'll hear me sing, we're bound for South Australia
verses: In South Australia I was born, (heave away, haul away)
In South Australia, 'round Cape Horn, (we're bound for South Australia)
As I stepped out one morning fair, (heave away, haul away)
'Twas there I met Miss Nancy Blair, (we're bound for South Australia)
I shook her up, I shook her down, (heave away, haul away)
I shook her round and round that town, (we're bound for South Australia)
There ain't one thing that grains my mind, (heave away, haul away)
To leave miss Nancy Blair behind, (we're bound for South Australia)
As you wallop round Cape Horn, (heave away, haul away)
You wish to God you'd never been born, (we're bound for South Australia)
As I land in Australias sun, (heave away, haul away)
A bottle of whiskey in my hand, (we're bound for South Australia)
It's back again to Liverpool, (heave away, haul away)
I spend my pay like a bloody fool, (we're bound for South Australia)
